conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: extruded walls with thickness, visible floor plane, interior volumes, angled/isometric-like view, and roof/ceiling removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness, readable room volumes, clean corners, proper angled viewpoint, and consistent cutaway with no major mesh breaks.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout reads plausibly consistent (kitchen/dining/core circulation and the angled bay/window-seat-like facade), but several details from the 2D plan are not verifiable or appear simplified (partition offsets, exact wall lengths, and opening placement/quantity).

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen cabinetry/appliances and some bathroom fixtures are present; however, most other furniture is absent, limiting room-identity confirmation beyond core fixtures.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean, readable model with distinct walls/floors and good visibility; neutral background and no text/UI clutter. Minor realism/surface-detail simplification but not obstructive.

detected_errors.description: Some wall/partition geometry appears simplified versus the dense 2D plan; exact proportional fidelity (lengths/offsets) cannot be fully confirmed and may deviate.
Doors/windows/openings are simplified; not all opening locations and sizes from the 2D plan are clearly matched in the 3D render.
Non-kitchen/non-bath furniture largely missing, reducing confidence in matching room identities beyond core service areas.

summary: A clear, valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong 3D fundamentals, but only moderate plan-level fidelity due to simplified partitions and openings and limited interior detailing.
